topic.title: Creating and DITA Content Key Reference

body.p: A DITA content key reference, or conkeyref, is a mechanism for inserting a piece of content from one topic into another topic. It is a version of the DITA content reference mechanism which uses keys to locate the content to reuse rather than direct references to topics containing reused content.

As with a conref, a conkeyref requires the element to be reused to have an id. It also requires the topic that contains the reusable content to be assigned a key in a map. As with all uses of keys, you can substitute different maps or use profiling to create more than one definition of key in a single map.

This will allow you to substitute different piece of content for the same conkeyref. In other words, the same conkeyref can pull in content from different sources depending on how your build is configured. This can make it easier to create and manage sophisticated content reuse scenarios.
To add a content key reference to a topic:

ol.li: In Author mode, place the insertion point when you want the reused content to be inserted.
Click the Insert a DITA Content Key Reference button on the DITA toolbar. The Insert Content Key Reference dialog is displayed.
Select the key for the topic containing the content you want to reuse and press the Subtopic button.
Select the Element ID of the element that you want to insert, and verify the content in the preview pane.
Make any other selections you need in the Insert Content Reference dialog.
